headline: Why Verizon and AT&T Stocks Fizzled on Friday
summary: Concerns about a top rival's performance put big telecoms Verizon (NYSE: VZ) and AT&T (NYSE: T) in the investor doghouse on Friday.  The aforementioned peer is T-Mobile US (NASDAQ: TMUS), which published its first-quarter results after market close on Thursday.  In terms of operational metrics, postpaid net customer additions of 495,000 topped AT&T's latest figure and contrasted very favorably with Verizon's decline.

In terms of operational metrics, postpaid net customer additions of 495,000 topped AT&T's latest figure and contrasted very favorably with Verizon's decline.

headline: What Wall Street's top CEOs are saying about tariff impacts
summary: Uncertainty about US President Trump's tariff policies has created a difficult environment for corporate America to make business decisions. Watch the video above to hear what some of the top CEOs on Wall Street, including Whirlpool (WHR) CEO Marc Bitzer, Southwest Airlines (LUV) CEO Bob Jordan, Chipotle (CMG) CEO Scott Boatwright, T-Mobile (TMUS) CEO Mike Sievert, and Procter & Gamble (PG) CEO Jon Moeller have told Yahoo Finance. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Google ad strength, T-Mobile falls, Pony AI & Tencent partnership
summary: As part of today's Market Minute, Brad Smith outlines the top stories on Wall Street in just 60 seconds. Internet stocks, including AppLovin (APP), Pinterest (PINS), and Reddit (RDDT), are gaining after Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) earnings showed ad revenue strength. T-Mobile (TMUS) stock plunges on the company's weak new subscriber count. Pony AI (PONY) partners with Tencent (TCEHY) on robotaxis. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
